author: Olivia Gomm
description: Finance Minister François-Philippe Champagne says the upcoming Nov. 4 budget will crack down on the “Driver Inc.” trucking industry scheme, which aims to undercut competition by avoiding tax obligations. “Budget 2025 is cracking down on Driver Inc., closing loopholes, making our roads safer, and standing up for drivers and businesses that play by the rules,” […]
title: Budget Will Crack Down on Trucking Industry Scheme That Aims to Undercut Competition: Finance Minister

author: Chandra Philip
description: Canadian hospitals are earning less than three stars on average in online ratings, according to a recent analysis. SecondStreet.org president Colin Craig said he analyzed the Google ratings of 83 hospitals across the country for 2024 and found the national average was 2.91 stars out of five—”a score that, if attached to a restaurant or garage, […]
title: Canadian Hospitals Receive Average of Less Than 3 Stars in Google Review Scores: Report

author: Matthew Horwood
description: ​​News Analysis Will Canadian internet users be more likely to receive a visit from the police for something edgy they posted online if Ottawa’s new hate crime bill becomes law, similar to what is happening in the UK? Conservative MPs raised that question in recent days after Justice Minister Sean Fraser introduced Bill C-9, also […]
title: Tories Say New Hate Crime Bill Risks UK-Style Speech Policing; Liberals Disagree

author: Christy Lee
description: ‘China’s unprecedented military buildup and its aggressive military actions speak for themselves,’ the Secretary of War said.
title: Hegseth: Dealing with China’s Military Buildup Urgent While Time Remains

author: T.J. Muscaro
description: He will now be known as Andrew Mountbatten Windsor.
title: Prince Andrew Stripped of Titles, Evicted From Royal Residence

author: Ryan Morgan
description: The Virginia senator said 'decisions about the use of American military force are not campaign strategy sessions.'
title: Democrats Excluded From Congressional Briefing on Boat Strikes, Warner Says

author: The Canadian Press
description: The head of Stellantis says a decision to move production of the Jeep Compass from Brampton, Ont., to Illinois was “not taken lightly.” Speaking to members of Parliament during a House of Commons industry and technology committee meeting today, Stellantis president Jeff Hines said the company is looking at options to get laid-off workers back […]
title: Stellantis President Grilled at House Committee Over Decision Move Production to US

author: Matthew Horwood
description: Police-reported drug crime has risen for the first time in 12 years, according to a new report by Statistics Canada. The statistics agency said on Oct. 29 that drug crime rose in 2024 to 128 incidents per 100,000 people, but noted that this “remained well below its historic peak” of 330 incidents per 100,000 people […]
title: Drug Crimes Rose in 2024 After 12 Years of Trending Downward: Statistics Canada

author: The Canadian Press
description: The head of Algoma Steel says that even if Canada reaches a deal with the United States on steel, there’s no going back to the way things were. Chief executive Michael Garcia, who is set to retire at year-end, says a resolution would help margins but that the company would have to be cautious. “It […]
title: Algoma Steel Not Banking on Return to US Market: CEO

author: The Canadian Press
description: Canadian Pacific Kansas City Ltd. reported a big profit boost in its latest quarter despite U.S. tariff disruption and fears over fallout from a potential merger of rivals down the line. The railway saw net income for the quarter ended Sept. 30 rise 10 percent year-over-year to $917 million. Revenues increased three percent to $3.66 […]
title: Canadian Pacific Profits Leap Despite US Tariffs and Looming Merger Prospect

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: Saskatchewan Premier Scott Moe says his province is troubled by the new tariffs that India plans to impose on Canadian yellow peas. Moe said the province took “immediate action” by urging Ottawa to quickly work toward the removal of India’s planned 30 percent duty on yellow peas, noting that the impact will be exacerbated by […]
title: Sask. Premier ‘Deeply Concerned’ About Upcoming New Indian Tariffs on Yellow Peas

author: PA Media
description: Virgin Trains hopes to introduce the UK’s first direct train services to Paris Charles de Gaulle airport, after overcoming the main barrier to launching international services through the Channel Tunnel. Sir Richard Branson’s company said it is focused on running trains between London’s St Pancras station and the city centres of Paris, Brussels and Amsterdam […]
title: Virgin Hopes to Run Direct Trains From London to Paris Charles de Gaulle Airport

author: PA Media
description: More than 55,000 UK companies are in serious financial distress and in danger of collapse without improvement over the coming year, according to research. Experts have warned that the upcoming autumn Budget “must deliver urgent support to avoid a wave of failures”, particularly among small businesses. The latest quarterly Red Flag Alert report by Begbies […]
title: More Than 55,000 UK Firms in Severe Distress, Research Shows

author: PA Media
description: The Government has chartered flights to help British nationals leave Jamaica in the wake of Hurricane Melissa. British nationals should use commercial flights as their first port of call to leave the country, the Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office (FCDO) said. This comes after the Government on Wednesday announced it would support Jamaica with £2.5 […]
title: Government Charters Flights to Help Britons Leave Jamaica After Hurricane

author: PA Media
description: The use of fireworks should be restricted to certain weekends, a Labour MP has suggested, as Bonfire Night approaches. Alex Mayer argued this would reduce the disruption caused by fireworks to animals and people. She has previously presented a petition to Parliament calling for quieter fireworks, which she described as “keeping the whoosh but getting […]
title: Fireworks Should Only Be Set Off on Weekends to Reduce Disruption, MP Says

author: PA Media
description: The public are being urged to use water wisely as officials warn that England must prepare for an ongoing drought into 2026. The national drought group, which includes the Met Office, regulators, government, water companies, and other organisations, convened on Thursday as autumn rainfall remains insufficient to offset the dry conditions of spring and summer. […]
title: Public Urged to Use Water Wisely as Drought Set to Continue Into 2026

author: Matthew Horwood
description: Canada’s financial intelligence agency says it sent a record number of cases to police for investigation in the 2025 fiscal year, in addition to issuing the largest number of violation notices in its history. The Financial Transactions and Reports Analysis Centre of Canada (FINTRAC) said in its 2024-25 annual report that it generated over 6,200 […]
title: FINTRAC’s Referrals to Police for Suspicious Transactions Hit Record in 2025

author: Chandra Philip
description: Three in five B.C. residents say a recent court decision to affirm aboriginal land title rights will harm the relationship between indigenous groups and the rest of the province, a new survey suggests. In the Angus Reid poll released Oct. 30, 60 percent of B.C. residents surveyed said the court ruling would harm the relationship between […]
title: 60% of BC Residents Say Land Rights Verdict Could Harm Relations Between Indigenous Groups, Residents

author: T.J. Muscaro
description: Hurricane Melissa made landfall on the island’s eastern end as a Category 3 storm.
title: Rubio Says US Ready to Send Humanitarian Aid to Hurricane-Hit Cuba

author: The Canadian Press
description: The MP overseeing Canada’s foreign aid is announcing $7 million in humanitarian relief for Caribbean states hit by Hurricane Melissa. Randeep Sarai, secretary of state for international development, says $5 million will go to life-saving help through emergency response agencies and health providers. The other $2 million will go to the World Food Programme to […]
title: Ottawa Announces $7 Million for Hurricane Melissa Relief in Caribbean Countries

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: The Cowichan decision granting aboriginal title to an area in Richmond, B.C., has real estate industry leaders concerned about how uncertainty could affect the market in that region. The Aug. 7 ruling recognizing Cowichan Nation’s aboriginal title to approximately 7.5 square kilometres of land in southeast Richmond has put the finality and binding nature of […]
title: BC Realtors See Wider Uncertainty, Possible Slowdown Following Aboriginal Title Claim Ruling

author: Guy Birchall
description: The Court of Auditors rejected the project, without explaining its reasons, after the bridge received approval from the government on Aug. 6.
title: Italian Government’s Plan for Bridge to Sicily Blocked by Court

author: The Canadian Press
description: A Richmond, B.C., councillor says a company based in the city has been refused financing for what she says is a $100 million project because of the Cowichan Tribes case. Coun. Alexa Loo says the company, which she isn’t naming, is currently working with the provincial government to get the certainty it needs to go […]
title: Councillor Says Cowichan Title Ruling Saw Bank Deny Financing for $100M BC Project

author: T.J. Muscaro
description: The storm regained some strength to become a Category 2 hurricane.
title: Hurricane Melissa Bound for Bermuda as Jamaica, Cuba Continue Recovery

author: Matthew Horwood
description: Trade discussions between Canada and the United States were moving in a positive direction in the weeks before U.S. President Donald Trump abruptly cancelled talks, according to Canada’s ambassador in Washington. “I don’t want to suggest that we were on the verge of an arrangement, but we had made more progress—in my opinion, in those […]
title: Canada and US Made ‘Progress’ on Deal Before Trade Negotiations Were Paused, Ambassador Says

author: Rachel Roberts
description: One of the five detained is suspected of being part of the four-man gang who carried out the robbery that stunned France, with two men already charged.
title: 5 More Arrests Over Louvre Crown Jewels Heist as New Details Emerge

author: Olivia Gomm
description: Finance Minister François-Philippe Champagne says the upcoming federal budget will need to include adjustments to the public service workforce to bring it back to “sustainable” levels. “Over the last few years, the civil service has increased at a level which I think is not sustainable,” Champagne told reporters at an Oct. 30 press conference. He […]
title: Public Service ‘Workforce Adjustments’ Needed in Budget to Reach Sustainable Levels: Finance Minister

author: Tom Ozimek
description: The soybean purchases are part of a broader deal that includes new accords on agricultural products, energy, and critical minerals.
title: China Agrees to Buy 25 Million Metric Tons of US Soybeans per Year, Bessent Says

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: An Ontario court judge is calling the $510 million legal fee for attorneys involved in a First Nations treaty rights case “unreasonable” and has ordered the amount be reduced to $23 million. The 2023 Robinson Huron Treaty settlement that sought to remedy unpaid treaty annuities for 21 First Nations resulted in a $10 billion settlement. […]
title: $510M in Lawyers’ Fees Deemed ‘Unreasonable’ by Judge in Treaty Lawsuit

author: Emel Akan, Travis Gillmore
description: The president announced that the United States and China had reached a one-year agreement to resolve several contentious issues.
title: Key Takeaways From Trump’s Asia Trip

author: Victoria Friedman
description: Because all parties in the race each fall well short of having an outright majority, some parties will have to negotiate with each other to form a government.
title: Geert Wilders’ Party for Freedom and D66 Party Neck-and-Neck as Final Votes Counted in Dutch Election

author: PA Media
description: The pound has fallen sharply as worries over the UK’s bleak fiscal outlook weigh heavily before next month’s closely-watched Budget. Sterling tumbled to a two-and-a-half-year low against the euro and a three-month low versus the US dollar, down 0.4% at 1.13 euros and 0.4% lower at 1.32 dollars, following steep falls on Tuesday. It comes […]
title: Pound Suffers Further Falls as UK’s Fiscal Troubles Set to Deepen

author: PA Media
description: The Government is being urged to go “further and faster” to protect the car industry from energy costs. The TUC said high energy bills in the UK meant car makers were struggling in the face of competition from abroad. On a visit to the Jaguar Land Rover factory in Solihull, the TUC general secretary Paul […]
title: Ministers Urged to Speed up Support for UK Car Industry Amid Rising Energy Costs

author: PA Media
description: New rules have been proposed in a bid to protect people and businesses from mobile messaging scams, regulator Ofcom has announced. The communications watchdog said it is seeking to introduce new rules after 100 million suspicious messages were reported to mobile providers last year. Ofcom said numbers have soared despite steps taken by mobile firms […]
title: Watchdog Proposes New Rules to Clamp Down on Mobile Scam Messages

author: The Canadian Press
description: Defence Minister David McGuinty says he has “every confidence” the Liberal government will be able to pass its fall budget through the current minority Parliament, despite his colleague’s concerns about securing enough votes. Government House leader Steven MacKinnon recently said he’s worried the budget might not win enough votes to pass through the House of […]
title: McGuinty Has ‘Every Confidence’ Fall Budget Will Pass Through Minority Parliament

author: Olivia Gomm
description: One way Prime Minister Mark Carney might deliver on his promised spending cuts is by allowing hundreds of programs to expire over the next three years, a new report predicts ahead of the release of the Nov. 4 federal budget. The Canadian Centre for Policy Alternatives (CCPA) released a report on Oct. 28 predicting the […]
title: Report Predicts Where Ottawa’s Promised Spending Cuts Could Come From

author: The Canadian Press
description: A Quebec minister has resigned amid an uproar over a recently passed law that imposes a new payment system on the province’s doctors. Social Services Minister Lionel Carmant announced his resignation from the governing party this morning, accompanied by Premier François Legault. Carmant’s daughter, a physician, has published an open letter criticizing the new law, […]
title: Quebec Minister Resigns Amid Furor Over Doctor Payment Bill

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Raw dog treats from an Alberta  company have been recalled across Canada after being tied to an ongoing salmonella outbreak. An investigation by the Public Health Agency of Canada determined four types of raw pet treat products from the Puppy Love and Puppy World brands contain Salmonella Oranienburg, a bacteria that causes the foodborne illness […]
title: Canadian-Made Dog Treats Recalled Amid Nationwide Salmonella Outbreak

author: The Canadian Press
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney toured a South Korean submarine on Thursday during a visit to the shipyards of Hanwha Ocean, one of two companies vying to build Canada’s next fleet of submarines. Carney was joined by Defence Minister David McGuinty and Vice-Admiral Angus Topshee, Commander of the Royal Canadian Navy, along with South Korean Prime […]
title: Carney Tours Korean Shipyard That’s Vying to Build Canada’s Next Submarine Fleet

author: Evgenia Filimianova
description: Trump revealed ongoing discussions with Moscow over potential nuclear arms reductions as Washington moves to restart nuclear weapons testing.
title: US, Russia Discussing Denuclearization, Trump Says

author: Sean Tseng
description: A $75 million Reagan-clip ad aired during the World Series has frozen Canada–U.S. talks and left Ottawa scrambling to revive negotiations.
title: Ontario Anti-Tariff Ad Sparks US Firestorm—What Can Ottawa Do Now?

author: PA Media
description: Sir Keir Starmer has declined to say he would stand by Labour’s manifesto pledge not to raise VAT, income tax or national insurance in next month’s Budget as he cited a grim economic backdrop. The Prime Minister said the Government will “lay out our plans” at the November 26 statement, as he sought to blame […]
title: Starmer Declines to Rule out Manifesto-Busting Tax Rises in Budget

author: PA Media
description: A small boat migrant has been jailed for at least 25 years for murdering a bank customer at random shortly after angrily complaining about his refused asylum application. Somali national Haybe Cabdiraxmaan Nur, who paid 400 euros to travel to the UK last year, could be seen on multiple CCTV cameras attacking Gurvinder Singh Johal […]
title: Small Boat Migrant Jailed for at Least 25 Years After Murdering Bank Customer

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: Despite Labor’s urgency, the Senate has extended its inquiry into the bill to March 2026, delaying any chance of passage this year.
title: Labor’s ‘Once-in-a-Generation’ Environment Bill Introduced, New Protection Agency Slated

author: Monica O’Shea
description: 'The United States and the United Kingdom... are, together, forging a new civilian nuclear partnership to accelerate advanced reactor technology,' she said
title: Senator Hume Introduces Private Members’ Bill to Lift Australia’s Ban on Nuclear Energy

author: Jarvis Lim
description: China's overcapacity is already damaging Korean firms, while experts note rising anti-China sentiment could also trigger domestic consumer backlash.
title: Seoul Risks Crippling Key Industries, Economic Retaliation With Deeper China Ties: Analysts

author: The Associated Press
description: LOS ANGELES—Trey Yesavage set a World Series rookie record with 12 strikeouts, and the Toronto Blue Jays opened Game 5 with back-to-back homers in a 6-1 victory over the Los Angeles Dodgers on Wednesday that moved them within one win of their first championship since 1993. Davis Schneider and Vladimir Guerrero Jr. homered on Blake […]
title: Blue Jays One Win Away From World Series Title After Game 5 Victory

author: Chandra Philip
description: Youth who start using marijuana before the age of 15 have more physical and psychological problems into early adulthood, according to a study by McGill University researchers. The study used data from the Quebec Longitudinal Study of Child Development, with researchers looking at cannabis use in 1,591 individuals between 12 and 17 years old, as […]
title: Youth Who Use Cannabis at Early Age More Likely to Have Health Problems as Adults, McGill Study Finds

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: The new law enforcement chief warned about new 'decentralised online networks' who glorify violence.
title: AFP Chief Flags Rise of ‘Nihilistic’ Networks Behind Youth Radicalisation

author: Joseph Lord
description: The latest strike announced by the administration in the Pacific comes amid a larger push to crack down on drug trafficking in the region.
title: Hegseth Announces New Lethal Strike on Alleged Drug Boat in the Pacific

author: Daniel Y. Teng, Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: The $3 billion pact will see Australia and the US work together to develop critical mineral supply chains outside of China.
title: US-Australia Critical Minerals Deal Lauded as ‘Strategic Inflection Point’: Commerce Chamber

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: The City of North Vancouver says a fraudulent letter has been circulated in its name indicating that private property rights in the area are at risk due to an August B.C. Supreme Court ruling that granted Aboriginal land title to an area in Richmond, B.C. Justice Barbara Young’s Aug. 7 ruling granted aboriginal title to […]
title: North Vancouver Says Aboriginal Title and Property Rights Notice Letter Is Fake

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: The American President has again offered warm words for Albanese, this time at a leaders' dinner in South Korea.
title: Trump Again Praises Albanese Ahead of APEC Summit

author: Joseph Lord
description: Four Republicans joined with Democrats to vote against President Donald Trump’s authority to impose additional tariffs on Canada.
title: Senate Votes Against New Tariffs on Canada

author: Nicole James
description: A forgotten CIA report on consciousness went viral after influencers decided it proved the Law of Attraction.
title: Did the CIA Discover How to Manifest Your Best Life?

author: Kimberly Hayek
description: The move is a significant shift in U.S. policy on exporting guarded nuclear submarine technology.
title: Trump Says US to Share Nuclear-Powered Submarine Tech With South Korea
